intro: Malortiea rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Malortiea rostrata thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
